column5: Acceptance Criteria or additional notes

column2: C = Conditional ; OK = Always Acceptable ; Remove = never accept ; Purple = needs legal review ; Blue = final review has not occurred  ;  no fill = final review is complete
FAA Clauses can be found at:

column5: Insert the clause in solicitations and contracts where the contractor is required to collect identical information from ten or more public respondents.

column2: Prohibition Against the Use of Federal Employees.
column5: Required in all contracts

column2: Preservation of, and access to, contract records (tangible and electronically stored information (ESI) formats).
column5: Used in all solicitations and contracts exceeding the simplified acquisition threshold. The Contracting Officer shall use the basic clause with its Alternate I in cost-reimbursement type contract
Used in solicitations and contracts where the contractor is required to produce, as an end product, publications or other written materials.

Used in all solicitations over the simplified acquisition limitation when the Contracting Officer has reason to believe that a potential organizational conflict of interest exists. The Contracting Officer shall describe the nature of the potential conflict in the provision. 

This is a solicitation provision (not a contract clause).  Therefore, it should not be included in a resulting awrad.

Used in solicitations and contracts for services above the simplified acquisition threshold whenever the Contracting Officer has reason to believe that the nature of the proposed contract requirements may present an organizational conflict of interest as defined at FAR Subpart 9.5. The Contracting Officer shall describe in the clause the nature of the potential conflict and the negotiated terms and duration of the limitation.
column6: This clause needs to be tailored to only impact the PI and his/her research team.  Work directly with the PI to determine the scope of work.  Have a faculty agreement signed by the PI confirming understanding that particpation in this project could impact future follow-on efforts.

column5: Used in all contracts.

In all solicitations for negotiated procurements expected to exceed the simplified acquisition limit. The provision may be used in simplified acquisitions when it is necessary to obtain business proposal information in making the award selection. If the proposed contract requires work on, or access to, HUD systems or applications (see the clause at 2452.239-70), the provision shall be used with its Alternate I. When the Contracting Officer has determined that it is necessary to limit the size of the technical and management portion of offers submitted by offerors, the provision shall be used with its Alternate II.

This is a solicitation provision (not a contract clause).  Therefore, it should not be included in a resulting awrad.

column2: Relative importance of technical evaluation factors to cost or price.
column5: Used in solicitations for contracts to be awarded using the tradeoff selection proces.  This is a solicitation provision (not a contract clause).  Therefore, it should not be included in a resulting awrad.
Used in solicitations for contracts that require the use of the FAR clause in 52.219-9, “Small Business Subcontracting Plan,” that will be awarded using the tradeoff source selection process.

column2: Estimated Cost, Base Fee and Award fee
column5: In all cost-plus-award-fee solicitations and contracts.
column6: Request removal.  Rely on FAR 52.216-11, Cost Contract - No Fee, with its Alternate I and HUDAR 2452.216-79, Estimated Cost (No Fee).  Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5: In fixed-price-award-fee solicitations and contracts.
column6: Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5: In all award-fee solicitations and contracts.
column6: Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5: In all award-fee solicitations and contracts.
column6: Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5: In all award-fee solicitations and contracts.
column6: Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5: Used in contracts in which task orders are individually negotiated and when there may be a need to issue unpriced task orders. (IDIQ Contracts).

column2: Minimum and Maximum Quantities or Amounts for Order
column5: Used in all indefinite-quantity and requirements solicitations and contracts.
Used in all solicitations for requirements contracts.  This is a solicitation provision (not a contract clause).  Therefore, it should not be included in a resulting awrad.

Used in all indefinite-delivery solicitations and contracts. If the supplies or services to be ordered under the contract are pre-priced in the contract, the orders will be issued on a fixed-price basis, and no order terms are negotiated before issuance, the Contracting Officer shall use the clause with its Alternate I. If the contract provides for the issuance of task orders for services on a negotiated basis (see also 2416.505), the Contracting Officer shall use the clause with its Alternate II
Used in all cost-reimbursement (no fee) type solicitations and contracts.
Used in all cost-plus-fixed fee type solicitations and contracts.
column6: Request removal.  Rely on FAR 52.216-11, Cost Contract - No Fee, with its Alternate I and HUDAR 2452.216-79, Estimated Cost (No Fee).  Confirm to the Sponsor that Virginia Tech is a nonprofit, public eduational institution that is unable to charge a fee.

column5:
Used in solicitations for contracts that are expected to exceed the dollar thresholds set forth at FAR 19.702 and are required to include the clause at FAR 52.219-9, Small Business Subcontracting Plan. 

This is a solicitation provision (not a contract clause).  Therefore, it should not be included in a resulting awrad.

column2: Notification of competition limited to eligible 8(a) concerns—Alternate III to FAR 52.219-18
column5: Use the clause at FAR 52.219-18, “Notification of Competition Limited to Eligible 8(a) Concerns,” with the clause at 2452.219-71, “Notification of Competition Limited to Eligible 8(a) Concerns—Alternate III to FAR 52.219-18,” for competitive 8(a) acquisitions processed under the Partnership Agreement cited in 2419.800.
column6: If this clause were included, Virginia Tech would be ineligible for contract awrad, as we are not an Eligible 8(a).

column5: The contracting officer shall substitute the clause at 2452.219-72, Section 8(a) Direct Award, for the clauses at FAR 52.219-11, “Special 8(a) Contract Conditions;” FAR 52.219-12, “Special 8(a) Subcontract Conditions;” and FAR 52.219-17, “Section 8(a) Award.”
column6: If this clause were included, Virginia Tech would be ineligible for contract awrad, as we are not an Eligible 8(a).

column5: In solicitations and contracts when a subcontracting plan is required.  See FAR 52.219-9.
Used in solicitations for contracts that are required to include the FAR clauses at 52.219-8, “Utilization of Small Business Concerns,” and 52.219-9, “Small Business Subcontracting Plan.”

column2: Accessibility of meetings, conferences, and seminars to persons with disabilities.
column5: Used in solicitations and contracts when the contract will require the contractor (including contractor employees and subcontractors) to hold meetings, conferences or seminars.

Used in all solicitations and contracts when the Government will provide information to the contractor, and/or when the contractor will obtain information on the Government's behalf to perform work required under the contract. The contracting officer shall describe all information to be provided to the contractor in paragraph (d)(1) of the clause.

column2: Review of Contracting Officer Protest Decisions.
